meanings.definition: The activity of promoting the sale of goods, especially by their presentation in retail outlets.
meanings.sent1: Merchandising involves creating attractive displays to encourage customers to buy products.
meanings.sent2: The success of a store often depends on the effectiveness of its merchandising strategies.
meanings.sent3: The clever merchandising of the new toy collection led to a shopping frenzy in the store.
meanings.sent4: Her talent for merchandising was like a magic spell that made the products fly off the shelves.
meanings.sent5: The art of merchandising is like painting a picture that convinces people to make a purchase.

meanings.definition: The products available for sale in a store.
meanings.sent1: The merchandising at the supermarket includes a wide variety of fresh produce.
meanings.sent2: Customers often make impulse purchases based on the merchandising near the checkout counter.
meanings.sent3: The quirky merchandising of the novelty items made customers smile as they shopped.
meanings.sent4: The merchandising of luxury watches in the boutique was like displaying pieces of art.
meanings.sent5: The colorful merchandising of candies in the store window caught the attention of passersby.
